meanings.definition: In a playful or mischievous manner.
meanings.sent1: She waggishly teased her friend during recess.
meanings.sent2: The puppy wagged its tail waggishly as it played with the ball.
meanings.sent3: The clown waggishly juggled colorful balls to entertain the children.
meanings.sent4: The mischievous squirrel waggishly stole nuts from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent5: The magician waggishly pulled a rabbit out of his hat to surprise the audience.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a sense of humor or playfulness.
meanings.sent1: His waggishly funny jokes always made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent2: The waggishly decorated room had colorful streamers and balloons.
meanings.sent3: The waggishly painted clown face on the wall made the room cheerful.
meanings.sent4: Her waggishly witty remarks brightened up the dull meeting.
meanings.sent5: The waggishly playful kitten chased after a ball of yarn with enthusiasm.
